title: Cannot access some websites since Win11 updated to 25H2
content: Evil Corp (aka Microsoft) updated my Windows 11 PC from 24H2 to 25H2 and now I cannot access quite a few websites (i.e. Amazon, Bank!, etc.) and some take a long time to load (surprisingly, my Firefox Home page...Google...also takes a while to load) . I searched the internet and found many so called fixes and most are very complicated and many contradict others. A lot of them say to disable DNS and reset network stack (using the command prompt) which I do not know how to do even though I worked in the tech business for 40 yrs (mainly data networking)...I retired 20 yrs ago...so I'm old...so I'm not as savvy with computers as I used to be. I tried changing a few Firefox settings, but nothing worked, so I changed them back to the original settings that worked before the update. If someone could give me detailed (and hopefully simple) instructions to resolve this issue, I would greatly appreciate it. I'm am in a bind, so a timely response would be great. Thanks so much, Steve

content: I am trying to log into a "http" website forum, of which I am a member and I am unable to do so, I think due to my Mozilla and or DuckDuckGo "Settings". This is the "Error" that I am consistently being shown: "Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to www.motoscrubs.com:80. SSL received a record that exceeded the maximum permissible length. Error code: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. Please contact the web site owners to inform them of this problem." The forum website does not use the "https" address as it does not trade and the extra cost for this type of domain would be prohibitive to its continued maintenance. Thank you for your time. BillR

title: Issues with Twitch.tv
content:
For roughly three months I have been experiencing issues with Twitch.tv that I do not have on other browsers. Namely, after a random period of time the site will just "go out" on me. I can keep watching streams that are open, but any attempt to open a new window or tab results in a page with no elements loaded. During this "out" period none of my chats will send, and any other attempts to interact with Twitch will fail. After a random period of time, things will go back to normal.

I've tried clearing my cache and cookies, I've tried disabling and uninstalling all of my extensions, I've tried updating the browser, I've uninstalling and reinstalling Firefox, I've tried Incognito Mode, I've tried a DNS flush, I've refreshed Firefox and it didn't work.

I have found one thing that has worked though. I created two new profiles. The first had the issues occur again, but the second one hasn't experienced any of the same issues as far as I've seen, so I think the issue is with my settings. The trouble is, I don't know which setting is the issue, and deleting prefs.js doesn't appear to reset my settings, even after restarting my browser. Is there some step I'm missing regarding deleting prefs.js?

Please do NOT suggest using Firefox Refresh, as I am NOT interested in going through all the steps again, especially when it didn't work at all the first time I tried.
creator: Generic_Soda

title: Firefox 145 and esr-140 in release Freebsd 14.2-Release Segmentationfault in headless
content:
I try hard to use firefox in headless mode for a python selenium project in freebsd. But firefox complains about GPUs and the absense of a X-Server, but this is a headless mode and crashes with a segmentation fault. Why does it want a GPU and X-Server in headless mode? Does not make sense.

The output when i try to start is : " firefox --headless

      • You are running in headless mode.

Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[0][GFX1-]: glxtest: Unable to open a connection to the X server (t=0.117314) [GFX1-]: glxtest: Unable to open a connection to the X server Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[0][GFX1-]: glxtest: Unable to open a connection to the X server (t=0.117314) |[1][GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI (t=0.117314) [GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI

Crash Annotation GraphicsCriticalError: |[0][GFX1-]: glxtest: Unable to open a connection to the X server (t=0.117314) |[1][GFX1-]: No GPUs detected via PCI (t=0.117314) |[2][GFX1-]: Failed to initialize shared font list, falling back to in-process list. (t=0.118314) [GFX1-]: Failed to initialize shared font list, falling back to in-process list. Segmentation fault (core dumped) firefox --headless "

Can anyone help me? Best regards Josef

title: I linked Mozilla to Google because of authenticator
content: I haven't been using Firefox a lot lately but I want to begin again. So I went to sign in and it asked me to authenticator myself but Firefox wasn't in there. Then I saw the Google botton and thought that maybe I used that the last time I logged in because my main address was in the authenticator. So I went through Google to sign in, entered my password and when it asked me to authenticate I used the Google address code. Not happening. In truth I don't even remember setting up 2 factor but I must have because I have the 10 digit codes. Anyway, I removed 2 factor and I'm going to charge my password and probably re enable it but as I was about to do that I see the thing that says my Google is now linked to my Firefox. My instinct is to unlink it, in fact, I want to distance myself from as much of those people as I can. However, the thought occurred that maybe it would be advantages somehow to keep them linked. As I write this I'm thinking no, I don't see it, but I'm old and not current on best practices. BTW, I have been using Brave as my primary browser and duck duck go as my search my real purpose for revving up Firefox is that I need a us phone number because I'm an American living abroad and I hate my bank. I have an address in California but no phone number and I need to get one that's not overly observable. My friend in Cambodia sent me a link to the new Firefox and said it was available in the extensions. I had just gotten started when the whole signing in thing happened and now I'm going to see if anyone has any thoughts before I carry on. Appreciate you. BTW I'm on my galaxy s20fe Android 13 ui 5.1 but I'm going to be concentrating my efforts on my S23FE running Android 16 UI 8

title: Fix "The bookmarks and history system will not be functional" error message
content:
Hello,

"The bookmarks and history system will not be functional" error message has suddenly appeared in just the past couple of days on my new DELL Inspiron 15 3535 with Windows 11. I have followed the first few items on the Mozilla Support page that comes up as soon as the initial Firefox opening page appears and that has not corrected the problem.

I have tried to follow the next few steps but can't really find what it calls for because I don't understand what it's talking about. I am not of the tech generation and do not speak the tech language. Most of the terms in there I do not know what or where they are on the laptop.

Is there anybody who could help me saw through the terminology and give me some ideas on how to simply solve my problem? All I really want to do is get to where my bookmarks are hidden and put them back in place where I can use them again.

Thank you in advance for any help anybody might have.

Kind Regards, Tom B.

title: Can't delete history
content: I can't delete history. I know how to do it (ie menu, click "clear recent history" etc etc) but it just doesn't do it. I've uninstalled Firefox and taken the option to "refresh" instead of reinstall. Didn't work. Uninstalled it again. In the reinstallation I asked that it NOT import my settings etc but it did it anyway. Back came Firefox, complete with my history! I just can't get a fresh start. With regret, I'm starting to use a different browser. I dislike doing that but at present I have no choice. Whenever I use Firefox, I just clutter up the place and can't get rid of history.

title: Making tabs and bookmarks larger
content: I just moved to a new computer. Still using the latest version of Firefox (145.x). But of course I have a much higher rez screen. So I'm looking at many more bookmarks across the menu bar, and they are all very small. As are the tabs at the top of the window. I can not find a way to make these larger in Settings. Grok tells me to work with CSS in the profiles folder, but that doesn't seem to work. (And I bet that every time a new version came out, I'd have to move or remake that CSS file and/or folder.) Is this just the way it is on the high-rez screen, or can someone point me to a solution?
creator: robow1

title: Vanished bookmark links
content:
I went away for a week, and during that time my iMac (apple desktop) turned off. When I rebooted it last night, Firefox loaded at the start as it has for years, but ALL of my bookmarks and activity history was gone. I've been collecting those bookmarks for nineteen years, and while there's a lot of useless stuff I've collected over the years, some of it is very important.

Please help.

title: Nagin 7 Online  How to Submit an Appeal to Mozilla: Email, Steps & Requirements
content:
Nagin 7 Online is the latest installment of India‚Äôs iconic supernatural drama franchise, has become one of the most awaited TV and OTT releases of the year. Known for its blend of fantasy, shape-shifting serpents, mythological twists, and dramatic storytelling, the seventh season promises even more powerful characters, intense rivalries, and eye-catching visual effects.

This season continues the legacy of the Naagin universe, introducing a new lead serpent queen who must protect her clan from ancient enemies. The plot revolves around revenge, hidden identities, and mystical powers while exploring a fresh romance that complicates the battle between good and evil. Each episode features suspenseful turns, supernatural conflicts, and mysteries that slowly unravel.Cast & Characters

The new season stars:

Priyanka Chahar Choudhary in the lead Naagin role

Karan Kundrra in a powerful supernatural character

Eisha Singh in a key supporting role
